nexttext: Then one can expand $\psi$ around the center of a vortex with winding number $\langle -1,0,1\rangle$, e.g., the location $(x,y)=(0,\pi/(3\sqrt{3}\kappa))$. Substituting $x=\epsilon \cos\theta$ and $y=\pi/(3\sqrt{3}\kappa)+\epsilon \sin\theta$ into $\psi$ and expanding it with respect to the infinitesimal $\epsilon$ we obtain

nexttext: The transverse magnetization thus is given by
prevtext: Then one can expand $\psi$ around the center of a vortex with winding number $\langle -1,0,1\rangle$, e.g., the location $(x,y)=(0,\pi/(3\sqrt{3}\kappa))$. Substituting $x=\epsilon \cos\theta$ and $y=\pi/(3\sqrt{3}\kappa)+\epsilon \sin\theta$ into $\psi$ and expanding it with respect to the infinitesimal $\epsilon$ we obtain
The transverse magnetization thus is given by

mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E4.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle E_{\mathrm{kin}}^{\mathrm{phase}}=\sum_{j=1,0,-1}\mathrm{w}_{j}^%
{2}\int\frac{\pi\phi_{j}^{2}}{r}dr," display="inline"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi>E</mi><mi>kin</mi><mi>phase</mi></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></munder></mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mi mathvariant="normal">w</mi><mi>j</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">∫</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>ϕ</mi><mi>j</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><mi>r</mi></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>𝑑</mo><mi>r</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E5.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle E_{\mathrm{int}}^{\mathrm{phase}}=2c_{2}\int\phi_{1}\phi_{-1}%
\phi_{0}^{2}rdr\int\cos\left[(\mathrm{w}_{1}-2\mathrm{w}_{0}+\mathrm{w}_{-1})%
\theta+(\alpha_{1}-2\alpha_{0}+\alpha_{-1})\right]d\theta." display="inline"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi>E</mi><mi>int</mi><mi>phase</mi></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">∫</mo><mrow><msub><mi>ϕ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>ϕ</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>ϕ</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>r</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>𝑑</mo><mi>r</mi></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">∫</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">w</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">w</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">w</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>𝑑</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>
